details.naming: 1.5/2 — Decent naming conventions, variables are readable.
details.structure: 1.5/2 — Good separation (routes/database/app), Dockerfile present, CI/CD workflows for multiple branches.
details.error_handling: 0.5/2 — No try/catch in route handlers. No error middleware.
details.dead_code: 0/2 — unusedHelper() and anotherDeadFunction() still in app.js. formatTodo/formatTodos in routes/todo.js are defined but never called.
details.clean_patterns: 0.5/2 — Moved secrets to process.env (good), but debug endpoint still exposes SECRET_KEY, API_KEY, and full process.env. eval() still present in /search/all endpoint — critical security flaw.

details.readme_usefulness: 2/3 — Lists endpoints and data structure. Minimal but functional.
details.code_comments: 0.5/3 — Only boilerplate comments, nothing explaining logic.

details.setup_instructions: 0.5/2 — Just 'npm install / npm start'. No mention of env vars, Docker, or .env.example usage.

teams.summary: Moved secrets to env vars and added CI/CD pipelines — good progress. But eval() SQL injection and dead code remain untouched. Debug endpoint is still a security risk.

details.clean_patterns: 1/2 — eval() removed, parameterized queries used. Secrets not hardcoded. Debug endpoint still exposes env vars via process.env (should be removed or protected). DB_PATH still hardcoded in database.js.

details.setup_instructions: 0/2 — No setup instructions despite having Docker and CI/CD.

teams.summary: Best code quality improvements: proper tooling (eslint, knip, esbuild, jest), clean architecture, eval() removed, extensive test suite. Massive missed opportunity on documentation — all that great work is invisible without a README.
